result.execSummary:
All charges against Azair Castaneda in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Azair Castaneda is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Azair Castaneda

records.addlTxt: Defendant Azair Castaneda in court.  Prosecuting attorney Michael J. Odden in court for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. State moves to dismiss, Court DISMISSES case without prejudice.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Davila, Branch 1.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible.  
The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 1.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/2/22 @ 1p
